snippet: A federal court ruled Tuesday that state legislators packed too many black voters into one congressional district in order to make adjacent districts safer for Republican incumbents.
abstract: United States Court of Appeals for the Fourth Circuit rules that Virginia state legislators packed too many black voters into one congressional district in order to make adjacent districts safer for Republican incumbents.
lead_paragraph: A federal court ruled Tuesday that state legislators packed too many black voters into one congressional district in order to make adjacent districts safer for Republican incumbents.
